Datsun Tanggapi Cross Tak Terkirim ke Dealer
05 Nov 2019, 20:20 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Datsun Cross tidak lagi menyandang status mobil harga terjangkau dan ramah lingkungan (LCGC) sejak diluncurkan pada Januari 2018. (Foto: CNN Indonesia/Safir Makki)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- PenjualanÂ Datsun Cross 'di ujung tanduk' setelah tidak terkirim satu unit pun ke dealer sepanjang September 2019. Satu bulan sebelumnya, distribusi Cross dari pabrik ke dealer cuma 223 unit.Head of Communication Nissan Motor Indonesia Hana Maharani menjelaskan kondisi yang cukup miris pada Cross berdasarkan data Gabungan Industri Kendaraan Bermotor Indonesia (Gaikindo) karena mengalami penyesuaian permintaan pasar. Pihak NMI mengaku permintaan konsumen terhadap Cross yang terus mengecil. Namun dengan kondisi tersebut, Cross belum akan 'disuntik mati'."Kami melakukan review rencana produksi menyesuaikan dengan permintaan pelanggan dan tren pasar," kata Hana kepada CNNIndonesia.com melalui pesan singkat, Selasa (5/11).Menurut Hana, pabrik Nissan yang berlokasi di daerah Karawang, Jawa Barat bakal difokuskan untuk memproduksi dua model mobil harga terjangkau ramah lingkungan (Low Cost Green Car/LCGC), yaitu Datsun Go dan Go+. "Saat ini prioritas produksi kami adalah Datsun GO dan GO+," ucap Hana.Datsun Cross pertama diluncurkan pada Januari 2018, namun distribusi tahap pertama ke dealer baru dilakukan satu bulan kemudian. Mobil keluarga Cross diputuskan tak berstatus LCGC, melainkan masuk ke segmen compact crossover dengan harga mulai Rp163 juta saat peluncuran perdana.Penjualan mobil itu sempat meledak ke level ribuan unit pada Maret tahun lalu, namun terus anjlok ke level ratusan unit, puluhan unit, bahkan tidak lebih dari 10 unit terjual per bulan. Pada November 2018 Cross juga tercatat tak meraih penjualan wholesales. (ryh/mik)
text:
Datsun Responds to Cross Not Sent to Dealers
05 Nov 2019, 20:20 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Datsun Cross no longer bears the status of affordable and environmentally friendly cars (LCGC) since it was launched in January 2018. (Photo: CNN Indonesia / Safir Makki)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Datsun Cross sales 'on the edge' after not sending a single unit to the dealer throughout September 2019. One month earlier, Cross distribution from the factory to the dealer was only 223 units. Head of Communication Nissan Motor Indonesia Hana Maharani explained the condition which is quite sad for Cross based on data from the Association of Indonesian Automotive Industries (Gaikindo) due to experiencing market demand adjustments. NMI claims that consumer demand for Cross continues to shrink. But with these conditions, Cross will not be 'shot dead. "" We are reviewing production plans to adjust to customer demand and market trends, "Hana told CNNIndonesia.com via text message on Tuesday (11/5). According to Hana, Nissan's factory which is located in the Karawang area, West Java will be focused on producing two affordable low-cost Green Car (LCGC) car models, namely Datsun Go and Go +. "At the moment our production priorities are Datsun GO and GO +," Hana said. The first Matsun Cross was launched in January 2018, but the distribution of the first stage to the new dealerships was carried out one month later. The Cross family car was decided not to be an LCGC status, but entered the compact crossover segment with prices starting at Rp.163 million at the initial launch. Sales of the car had exploded to the level of thousands of units in March last year, but continued to plummet to the level of hundreds of units, dozens of units, even not even more than 10 units sold per month. In November 2018 Cross also recorded no sales of wholesales. (ryh / mic)
